meanings.definition: Make minor changes in (a text) in order to make it fairer, more accurate, or more up-to-date.
meanings.sent1: She amended her essay to correct a spelling mistake.
meanings.sent2: The teacher amended the student's paper for grammar errors.
meanings.sent3: He amended his story to include a happy ending.
meanings.sent4: The artist amended the painting by adding more vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The chef amended the recipe by reducing the amount of salt.

meanings.definition: Make minor changes in (a law or legal document) in order to improve it or correct it.
meanings.sent1: The committee amended the law to protect endangered species.
meanings.sent2: The judge amended the contract to clarify the terms.
meanings.sent3: The lawyer amended the will to include the family pet as an heir.
meanings.sent4: The government amended the constitution to grant more rights to citizens.
meanings.sent5: The parliament amended the bill to address public concerns.
